field.label: Enable on Frontend
field.comment: Whether or not to enable Klevu Search in the frontend. Data sync will still take place even if this is disabled, according to the Data Sync Settings.

field.label: JS API Key
field.comment: JS API key is used for performing searches in the frontend.

field.label: REST API Key
field.comment: REST API key is used for syncing product information to the backend.

field.label: Hostname
field.comment: Hostname is used for sending store configuration parameters to Klevu.

field.label: Product Synchronization URL
field.comment: Product Synchronization URL is used for sending product synchronization API requests to Klevu.

field.label: Cloud Search URL
field.comment: Cloud Search URL is used for sending search API requests to Klevu.

field.label: Cloud Search V2 URL
field.comment: Cloud Search V2 URL is used for sending search API requests to Klevu.

field.label: Analytics URL
field.comment: Analytics URL is used for reporting search terms, clicks and checkouts to Klevu.

field.label: JS URL
field.comment: JS URL is used for powering the JavaScript Klevu based template and quick search on the frontend.

field.label: Tiers URL
field.comment: Tiers URL is used for retrieving information about the Klevu Plan you are signed up to.

field.label: Ordering & Rendering
field.comment:
Native: Klevu will be disabled, and will not power the rendering or result ordering of your search results page.
Klevu JS Theme: Use Klevu's JavaScript Theme to render and order the results of your search results page. Recommended for best results.
Preserve your Magento layout: Klevu will control the ordering of results, but Magento will render your search results page.

field.label: Product List Sort Order Options
field.comment:
Select the sort order options available on the frontend. Leaving the Label Override field blank will use the system label shown in the dropdown field.
If you do not add any sort order options, the default sort orders provided by Klevu will be used by default.
For further details, see this knowledgebase article.
Note: This option has no effect when using Klevu JSv2 Theme, where you can instead override the templates and functionality yourself to achieve the desired result.

field.label: Sort by Klevu Relevance
field.comment: When option "Klevu Powered - Preserve Theme Layout" is selected.

field.label: Sort Relevance Label
field.comment:
On the Search Results Page, text label will be shown in the sorting drop-down.
Default label will be as Relevance.

field.label: Enable Product Sync
field.comment: Include Magento Products with your search results. We will monitor changes to your products and send them to Klevu based on the above frequency.

field.label: Include Visibility: Catalog
field.comment: With this disabled, only products with Visibility: "Catalog, Search" or "Search" will be sent to Klevu. Enable this setting to also include products with Visibility: "Catalog". Important: Please contact support@klevu.com before enabling this option to prevent "Catalog" products appearing in your search results.

field.label: Frequency
field.comment: Configure how often Klevu will synchronise changes to Products, Categories and CMS data. Learn more about the available options for synchronising data here: Magento 2 Data Sync.

field.label: Enable Order Sync
field.comment:
Recommended. Klevu Search uses transactional data as a ranking factor to show the most popular products to your customers. Enable this option to send recent Orders to Klevu via the native Magento internal cron.
Schedule set in the Order Sync Frequency field.

field.label: Enable Product Rating Sync From Magento
field.comment: Enable Magento Rating Sync

field.label: Order Sync Frequency
field.comment: Configure how often to send order information to Klevu. Learn more about the available options for synchronising data here: Magento 2 Data Sync.

field.label: Custom Order Sync Frequency
field.comment:
Crontab schedule for order synchronisation, see our Magento 2 Data Sync article for help generating and testing schedules.
Some common schedules include
  • 0 * * * * : Hourly on the hour
  • 0 2 * * * : 2am every day (local time)
  • 0 */6 * * * : Every six hours, on the hour, starting at midnight

field.label: Enable Category Sync
field.comment: Include Magento Categories with your search results. We will monitor changes to your categories and send them to Klevu based on the above frequency.

field.label: Sync Status
field.comment: This is the date the last Product, Category or CMS Page was sent to Klevu, which may have been triggered via Cron, CLI Command or manual sync. Use Store View scope for store specific values. The date comes from the klevu_product_sync database table, so the timezone may be different to expected.

field.label: Cron Status
field.comment: This is the status of the native Magento Cron, which can either be 'Running' or 'Completed'. If the status is 'Running' and the date is quite old, there might be a problem with your sync. The date comes from the cron_schedule database table, so the timezone may be different to expected.

field.label: Automatic Lock File Removal
field.comment: Control how regularly old lock files are automatically removed. Learn more about Klevu Lock Files.

field.label: Lock File Status
field.comment: If any of the above lock files are quite old, there might be a problem with your sync. Learn more about Klevu Lock Files. The dates come from the server files, so the timezone may be different to expected.

field.label: Sync All Data
field.comment: Use this button to schedule all Products, Categories and CMS Pages need to be synchronised with Klevu. These entities will then be sent during the next data sync via Cron, CLI Command or manual sync.

field.label: Sync Updates Only
field.comment: Switch to Store View to sync recently modified entities.

field.label: Sync Updates Only
field.comment: Use this button to open a new tab where the data synchronisation will begin immediately, synchronising any Products, Categories or CMS Pages which have been modified since the last sync to Klevu.
Switch to Store View scope to manage.

field.label: Respect is anchor Category
field.comment: With this option set to "No", Klevu will treat each category-product association independently and will only link products that are directly added to a category. By setting this to "Yes", Klevu will respect the "is anchor" setting of each category and category-product association will be inherited.

field.label: Boosting Attribute
field.comment: Select the attribute you wish to use as the Boosting attribute in Klevu. The Boosting attribute is a decimal or integer product attribute. To promote a product simply give the product a score higher than 1 and to demote give a score lower than 1 (i.e. 0.1)..

field.label: Other Attributes To Use In Search
field.comment: By default, Klevu uses the following attributes in search: name, sku, description, short_description, price and rating. To add more attributes to search, please select one or more attributes from the list above. This change will take place during the next data sync via Cron, CLI Command or manual sync.
Switch to Store View scope to manage.

field.label: Use Secure Base Url for Products and Images
field.comment: Choose Yes to use secure base url from Store > Cofiguration > Store view > General > Secure > Base URL. This change will take place during the next data sync via Cron, CLI Command or manual sync.
Switch to Store View scope to manage.

field.label: Use Configurable Product's Image in Search.
field.comment: Choose Yes to use configurable product's image in search. This change will take place during the next data sync via Cron, CLI Command or manual sync.

field.label: Image Width
field.comment: Image Width.

field.label: Image Height
field.comment: Image Height.

group.label: Display prices after Customer Group load

field.label: Display prices after Customer Group Load
field.comment: Recommended if using Customer Group Pricing. This will delay the rendering of prices on the page until the current customerâ€™s group is available, which will ensure the customer group price is displayed rather than the default."

field.label: Use Collection Method
field.comment: Recommended. Use this option to choose between Collection Method and Object Method for loading products during data synchronisation. Learn more here: Object vs Collection Method.

field.label: Order Sync Max Batch Size
field.comment:
By default (with no value entered in the field above), the synchronisation process will attempt to push all unsent order records.
Setting a maximum batch size limits each cron execution to sending at most the configured number of orders. Additional orders will be sent in a subsequent cron job, resuming from the earliest unsynced order.
If you are encountering issues with memory or execution time limits, a lower batch size combined with more frequent synchronisations may mitigate the issue, however there is a danger of orders backing up if the combination of frequency and batch size are not sufficient to process average daily order volumes.

field.label: IP Address Field for Order Data
field.comment: By default, Klevu considers the remote_ip field of table sales_order for tracking the Shoppers IP in the checkout data but if the website is using x_forwarded_for field of table sales_order, please select x_forwarded_for option.

field.label: Force Logging
field.comment: Use this setting to override default Magento log settings and enable logging. Log messages are saved in Klevu_Search.{store-code}.log

field.label: Enable Preserve Layout Log
field.comment: Use this setting to enable Klevu Preserve Layout log. Once this setting is set to "yes", it will log the Product data and Search request data in the file magento-root/var/log/Klevu_Search_Preserve_Layout.{store-code}.log. Please make sure to enable this option only when it is required to debug search request data otherwise it can impact the frontend search page and category pages.

field.label: Using an ERP OR 3rd party tool for product updates
field.comment: If store is integrated with an ERP OR 3rd party tool for product updates (i.e stock or price data),set this value to 'Yes'.

field.label: Theme Version
field.comment: This setting configures which version of the Klevu JS is used to display quick search, search results page and category pages when using a JS based theme. Please do not modify this unless you have read and understood the following guide: JSv1 vs JSv2 in Magento.

field.label: Quicksearch Input Selector
field.comment:
CSS / JavaScript selector used to identity the frontend search input element to which Klevu's quicksearch context will be added.
Default: input[type=text][name=q]

field.label: Object vs Collection Method
field.comment: This notification will appear when we detect you are using Object Method instead of the more efficient Collection Method. If you have reviewed this already and decided to stick with Object Method, please disable this warning. Learn more here: Object vs Collection Method

field.label: Lock Files
field.comment: This notification will appear when we detect a Lock file older than the period you have specified in 'Data Sync Settings > Automatic Lock File Removal'. Warning: By specifying 'At the top of every Magento Admin page', an attempt to read multiple files from disk will take place on every page of your admin panel, which can impact performance. Learn more here: Magento 2 Lock Files

field.label: Orders with same IP Address
field.comment: This persistent notification will appear when we detect orders from the same IP address in the sales_order table in last 30 days. Warning: By specifying 'At the top of every Magento Admin page', we will attempt to read records from the order table on every single page of your admin panel, which can impact performance. If you have reviewed this message already, you can choose to disable this warning.

field.label: Display Product Prices In Klevu Search
field.comment: Choose 'Including Tax' to show prices with Tax in Klevu search results. </br> This change will take place during the next data sync via Cron, CLI Command or manual sync.
